comment.author: 35740357@N03
comment._content: SCAVENGER HUNT KEYWORD: New NEXT SCAVENGER HUNT CLUE: There are five known original copies of the Gettysburg Address. In the 1990s, Arlen Specter wrote this President’s Chief of Staff requesting that the White House loan its copy of the famous speech to the Gettysburg Museum in Specter’s home state of Pennsylvania. Find Specter’s letter and you’ll find your next clue. NOTE: This is a clue for the National Archives' Discovering the Civil War scavenger hunt. Want to play? It starts on Monday, April 26, 2010 and runs until Friday, April 30, 2010. Learn more about the hunt on the U.S. National Archives' Facebook page: www.facebook.com/usnationalarchives. Good luck! Jill (U.S. National Archives)
